title: Timberwolves Bring Back Prince-Inspired Jerseys With New PurpleÂ Court
summary: The Wolves originally introduced the Prince-themed look during the 2018â€“19 NBA season.
body: The Minnesota Timberwolves brought back their Prince -inspired City Edition uniforms for the first time this season during Saturdayâ€™s (Nov. 15) home game against the Denver Nuggets, debuting a matching on-court design and arena programming that paid tribute to the Minneapolis icon. The return of the purple uniforms also marked the first time the team has paired the jerseys with a Purple Rain-inspired decal at center court inside Target Center. Timberwolves honoring the late legend Prince with their City Edition uniforms and court tonight! All in the details ğŸ‘€ Watch on NBA League Pass: https://t.co/wDXqPzcHiR pic.twitter.com/U2WXhgqONC — NBA (@NBA) November 16, 2025 The Wolves originally introduced the Prince-themed look during the 2018â€“19 NBA season in collaboration with the Prince Estate and Nike, a partnership that returned for the 2025â€“26 campaign. The updated uniforms feature a paisley pattern over the right shoulder in reference to Princeâ€™s Purple Rain jacket, while the â€œMPLSâ€ lettering on the shorts nods to the artistâ€™s close ties to the Minneapolis sound and the Twin Cities community. Inside the arena, fans were greeted with a full Prince-themed presentation. â€œWhen Dâ€¦

title: Pete Townshend Brings â€˜Quadrophenia, A Rock Balletâ€™ to NYC on His Own Dime, Dedicates U.S. Premiere to Late Choreographer PaulÂ Roberts
summary: Ansel Elgort co-stars in the stage production based on The Who's 1973 album.
body: After 61 years of smashing guitars and raising the bar on rock music as an art form, The Who wrapped up their farewell tour six weeks ago in California. But even if the song is over, Pete Townshend is far from finished exploring the creative opportunities presented by the bandâ€™s sprawling catalog. Related Who Done It: Ahead of The Who’s Final Tour, a Look at Six Decades of Concert Reviews Jennifer Aniston, Max Greenfield Help Alex Warren Announce Arena Tour Kim Kardashian and Britney Spears Cozy Up With Khloe at Pajama Party: 'Calabasas Nights' On Friday (Nov. 14), Townshend brought a ballet production of the bandâ€™s acclaimed 1973 rock opera, Quadrophenia , to the New York City Center in Manhattan. Directed by Rob Ashford and soundtracked by an orchestral version of the double-album arranged by Rachel Fuller, Quadrophenia, A Rock Ballet â€”which previously played in London as Quadrophenia, A Mod Ballet â€”made its Stateside debut. The show boasts a remarkably talented cast (including Ansel Elgort as the bare-chested, guitar-bashing Godfather) who deftly split the difference between stunning dance moves and the expressive yet subtle dramatics this story–aboutâ€¦

title: Dominant first half helps Man City beat Man Utd in derby
summary: First-half goals from Rebecca Knaak, Khadija Shaw and Lauren Hemp secure a comfortable victory for Manchester City against Manchester United in the Women's Super League.

title: Buttler, Archer & Salt retained but Livingstone released in IPL
summary: Liam Livingstone is released by defending Indian Premier League champions Royal Challengers Bengaluru after a disappointing season.

title: Knaak heads in opener for Man City in derby
summary: Manchester City take the lead through Rebecca Knaak as she heads in the opening goal against Manchester United in the Women's Super League.

title: England's chance is now: Perth, the Optus & Ashes
summary: Good news for Mark Wood and bad for Josh Hazlewood enhance England's chances for the first Ashes Test - now they must take it, writes Stephan Shemilt.

title: McIlroy in joint lead as he closes on Dubai title
summary: Rory McIlroy moves into the joint lead of the DP World Tour Championship as he closes on a seventh Race to Dubai title.

title: Hewett and Reid beaten in quest for record title
summary: Great Britain's Alfie Hewett and Gordon Reid lose an epic Wheelchair Masters final as they narrowly fail to win a record fourth title.

title: Australia's Hazlewood out of first Ashes Test
summary: Josh Hazlewood is ruled out of the first Ashes Test, leaving Australia's pace bowling seriously depleted for the series opener in Perth.

title: 'All or nothing' for Republic of Ireland in Hungary
summary: Republic of Ireland winger Chiedozie Ogbene accepts Sunday's final World Cup qualifying game against Hungary in Budapest is "all or nothing".

title: WSL derby win 'not impossible' for Spurs
summary: This time last season Tottenham were struggling in the Women's Super League. But with a new manager and fresh belief, this season they are in top-four contention.

title: Why has Sweden's World Cup bid gone wrong and can Potter save them?
summary: Graham Potter was appointed Sweden manager in October after spells at West Ham and Chelsea. Is he the perfect fit?

title: Thomas to miss start of 2026 after back operation
summary: Two-time major winner Justin Thomas is sidelined after back surgery and "will miss some events in the beginning of 2026".

title: 'I thought my career was over - I felt like punching a wall'
summary: England shooter Eleanor Cardwell feared a cruel recurrence of a knee injury would end her career, but she is back with the Roses for their New Zealand series.

title: Le Tissier on her and stepbrother Alex Scott's unique football journey
summary: Manchester United and England defender Maya le Tissier reflects on her experiences growing up in Guernsey with stepbrother and Bournemouth midfielder Alex Scott who has recently received his first call-up for England.

title: Parker denies taking 'any prohibited substance'
summary: Former world heavyweight champion Joseph Parker denies taking "any prohibited substance" after testing positive for cocaine.

title: Alex Scott takes on Australian 'This or That?'
summary: Football Focus presenter Alex Scott prepares for jungle life in I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here as she takes on an Australian-themed "This or That?".

title: I feel part of a big football nation - Bellamy
summary: Wales boss Craig Bellamy says he feels part of a big football nation now as his side battle to finish second in their World Cup qualifying group.

title: 'Proper players and me' - Fifa award nomination shocks Brentford's Cheatley
summary: Brentford's Ashley Cheatley is on Fifa's shortlist for the annual Marta Award after scoring one of the best goals by women worldwide.

title: 'We have concerns' - are summer sports aiming for Winter Olympics?
summary: Winter Olympic Federations say they do not want 'summer sports' in the Winter Olympics with cross-country running and Cyclocross bidding to be in 2030 Winter Olympics in the French Alps.

title: Seven games, 20 goals, none conceded - England close in on perfection
summary: England have cruised through World Cup qualifying, winning all seven of their games and scoring 20 unanswered goals, setting several records and leaving them on the cusp of another.

title: Dallas Cowboys return to NFL practice after death of Kneeland
summary: Dallas Cowboys coach Brian Schottenheimer and defensive tackle Soloman Thomas pay their respects to former player Marshawn Kneeland, after the defensive end passed away aged 24.

title: Henderson stars as Patriots ease past Jets
summary: Rookie running back TreVeyon Henderson scores three touchdowns as the New England Patriots beat the New York Jets to record their eighth straight win.

title: Conor Benn opens up about 'very traumatic' upbringing
summary: Conor Benn speaks to BBC Sport's Ade Adedoyin about attending a fundamentalist Christian school, saying "they believed I had demons in me".

title: An Ashes fanatic? Test your knowledge with all of our quizzes
summary: The Ashes returns on 21 November and to mark it why not have a go at testing your cricket knowledge?

title: It's about building a team - Tuchel on win over Serbia
summary: England manager Thomas Tuchel says he is "building a team" and asking the players to leave their egos behind after Thursday's 2-0 win over Serbia.

title: 'If Kane were to get injured, where would that leave England?'
summary: Former England strikers Wayne Rooney and Emile Heskey join Kelly Somers and Kae Kurd to discuss England's over-reliance on Harry Kane and the alternative options at number nine.

title: 'Where do we look now?' Heskey on lack of England strikers
summary: Emile Heskey feels it is difficult to see who the next main England striker will be, following the decline of the traditional number nine.

title: Harder & Carmona star in Champions League best goals
summary: Watch the best goals from the latest round of fixtures from the Women's Champions League, including Olga Carmona's screamer for Paris St-Germain and Pernille Harder's equaliser against Arsenal.

title: A 'circus' or sign of the times - should Joshua take Paul fight?
summary: BBC Sport assesses whether Anthony Joshua's prospective fight with YouTuber Jake Paul would be a good or bad idea.

title: 'Who knows what happens next?' - Eubank and Benn meet again
summary: Watch the best bits from Chris Eubank Jr and Conor Benn's news conference before their rematch at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

title: 'You've got to be united' - Bairstow's Ashes warning to England
summary: Former England batter Jonny Bairstow says the squad must "front up early" and "get on the front foot" if they are to beat Australia and win the Ashes down under.

title: The Ratcliffe revolution - inside Man Utd's exodus and rebuild
summary: BBC Sport tells the story of how Sir Jim Ratcliffe ripped apart and rebuilt Manchester United's leadership team.

title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
summary: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

title: 'I deeply hurt people by moving to Saudi Arabia'
summary: In an interview with BBC Sport, Ashleigh Plumptre says she regrets losing the trust of some LGBT fans in women's football by moving to Saudi Arabia.

summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first Â£1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
